meanings.definition: The act of engaging in gossip or spreading rumors.
meanings.sent1: Her gossipries about the neighbors caused a lot of trouble.
meanings.sent2: The office was full of gossipries about the upcoming changes.
meanings.sent3: At the party, the gossipries about the missing cake were quite entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The gossipries in the small town spread faster than wildfire.
meanings.sent5: She couldn't resist the temptation of joining the gossipries during lunch break.

meanings.definition: The quality of being prone to gossip.
meanings.sent1: Her constant gossipries made her unpopular among her friends.
meanings.sent2: The group avoided discussing personal matters due to his gossipries.
meanings.sent3: His gossipries were so obvious that even the walls seemed to listen.
meanings.sent4: The gossipries in the air were thick enough to cut with a knife.
meanings.sent5: The room was filled with an uncomfortable silence after her gossipries were revealed.

meanings.definition: A collection of gossip or rumors.
meanings.sent1: The magazine was full of juicy gossipries about celebrities.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed sharing the latest gossipries with her friends.
meanings.sent3: The town's gossipries were like a never-ending soap opera.
meanings.sent4: The gossipries in the school hallway were like a tangled web.
meanings.sent5: The book was a treasure trove of scandalous gossipries about the royal family.
